title: CSV Format
content:
CSV Format

This article is written in CSV (.csv) format.

What is CSV?

CSV (Comma-Separated Values) is a simple file format used to store tabular data, such as a spreadsheet or database.

Benefits

  • Simple and universal format
  • Works with spreadsheet applications
  • Easy to export from databases
  • Human-readable plain text

Use Cases

CSV format is perfect for:

  • Bulk importing help articles
  • Managing content in spreadsheets
  • Simple data migration
  • Quick content updates

Format Structure

A CSV file for help content includes these columns:

  • id: Unique identifier
  • title: Article title
  • category: Category name
  • tags: Comma-separated tags
  • content: HTML content

title: Troubleshooting Tips
content:
Troubleshooting Tips

Common issues and solutions when working with multiple content formats.

Format Detection

The library automatically detects the format based on file extension:

  • .md = Markdown
  • .json = JSON
  • .csv = CSV

Common Issues

Markdown Not Rendering

Make sure you've registered the Markdown parser in your HelpProvider configuration.

JSON Validation Errors

Ensure your JSON files are valid using a JSON validator tool.

CSV Encoding Issues

Use UTF-8 encoding for CSV files with special characters.
